title.value: Переваримость питательных веществ и продуктивность телят при использовании энергонасыщенного концентрата из маслосемян озимой сурепицы
The digestibility of nutrients and productivity of calves when using energy-saturated concentrate made of winter few seeded colza
The digestibility of nutrients and productivity of calves when using energy-saturated concentrate made of winter few seeded colza

journal.title: Zootechnical Science of Belarus: collection of scientific papers

person.name: Gurina, D.V., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus)
Ganushchenko, O.F., Vitebsk State Academy of Veterinary Medicine (Belarus)
Tsarenok, A.A., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Institute of Radiology

abstract.value: Positive influence of substitutes of whole milk (SWM) with different structure of energy saturated concentrate on the basis of wild cabbage oil seed in diet structure on forages eatability, digestibility and use of nutrients, blood morphological-biochemical structure, and bulls' productivity is established. It is revealed, that the best digestibility of dry and organic substance - on 2,27 and 2,14%, fat - on 7,18%, protein - on 4,32%, cellular tissue - on 2,77% it is noted at calves, consumed SWM with use of a concentrate on the basis of wild cabbage and a soya flour, 70 and 30% on weight accordingly (distinctions are authentic). Feeding of calves by SWM with use of flax seed 33,3% on weight, wild cabbage - 33,3%, soya flour - 33,4% are provided with authentic increase fat digestibility on 3,65%, protein - on 10,14% in comparison with a control variant. Barley middling inclusion in SWM structure on 10% on weight, flax seed - 25%, wild cabbage - 30%, soya flour - 35% allows to authentically increase the dry substance digestibility on 3,39%, fat - on 4,19%, protein - on 4,78%. Calves diets, including SWM with different concentrate composition, render positive influence on oxidation-reduction processes in animals organism to what the morphological-biochemical structure of blood testifies. Thus increase of the protein contents in blood whey on 3,7-5,4% and urea decrease on 7-14% is observed. Substitutes of whole milk with inclusion of different concentrate composition allow to receive daily gain average of calves 780-810 g, that above a control variant on 5,4-9,5% at forages expenses 3,4-3,7 on 1 kg of a gain or below the control over 3-11%
